node.Title: GIPHY’s AI Can Identify Lil’ Yachty, Can Yours?
node.Description: GIPHY is excited to announce the public availability of our custom machine learning model, The GIPHY Celebrity Detector, which is able to discern over 2,300 celebrity faces with 98% accuracy. node.Title: gRPC Adoption in GIPHY
node.Description: GIPHY’s API servers handle over a million requests a minute. To handle this load, we divide the work between a variety of microservices, each of which fulfills part of the request. For example, one service performs searches, another supplies metadata about GIFs, yet another validates user credentials, and so on. Our first iteration of microservices […]

node.Title: A Pragmatic Approach to Tech Debt Reduction
node.Description: Almost every company accumulates tech debt as time goes on. Tight deadlines, changing requirements, scaling issues, poor or short-sighted system designs, knowledge silos, inconsistent coding practices, turnover of key staff — these things all happen and can contribute to tech debt. So what can be done about it once it’s there?

node.Title: How to increase performances on custom UICollectionsViewLayout

node.Title: My Journey to trivago
node.Description: Sometimes, when I look back over the time I have spent working at trivago, I see how it changed my life and how lucky I have been to get the chance to work among this amazing community, to live and to learn with them. I look back and see a younger version of myself looking desperately for something different and, by just sheer luck, getting it.

node.Title: JavaScript Workshop with Kyle Simpson
Building fast and reliable web applications
node.Description: Testing your functionality is important, but what happens if other factors come into play? In this blog post we show how trivago handles non-functional testing for every commit and how we scaled it.
